intro: Dalechampia bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
